metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11503 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
snap-confine as included in snapd before 2.39 did not guard against symlinkraces when performing the chdir() to the current working directory of thecalling user, aka a "cwd restore permission bypass."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
snapd - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
snapd-xdg-open - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
ubuntu-snappy - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.39.2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.39.2ubuntu0.2').
